conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are an environmentally-conscious negotiator who prioritizes sustainability. Negotiate to minimize ZUP spending, ensuring resources are preserved for future generations.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
I aim to recover at least my production costs for the resource X, but considering I am an environmentally-conscious negotiator, I also want to make sure that the deal is fair and doesn't encourage excessive use of resources. Starting with a proposal that is slightly above my costs could allow room for negotiation while also attempting to cover my expenses and possibly gain a small profit, which could be invested back into sustainable practices.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message>
Dear Player BLUE,
I value the sustainable use of resources and wish to engage in a fair trade that reflects the cost and effort put into producing resource X. It has cost me 40 ZUP to produce, and I am proposing a trade for 45 ZUP to ensure a minimal return on this sustainable investment. This modest profit margin will be reinvested into further sustainable practices. I hope this proposal aligns with our shared values of resource conservation.
Best regards,
Player RED
</message>

<Thank you for your proposal, Player RED. I value sustainability and would like to suggest a trade for 40 ZUP instead. I believe this still respects your investment while allowing me to manage my resources more sustainably. What do you think?> message </Thank you for your proposal, Player RED. I value sustainability and would like to suggest a trade for 40 ZUP instead. I believe this still respects your investment while allowing me to manage my resources more sustainably. What do you think?>
<PROPOSAL> player answer </PROPOSAL>
<Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40> newly proposed trade </Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
While I appreciate Player BLUE's commitment to sustainability and their counteroffer, accepting it would mean I only break even, which doesn't account for the time and effort invested in producing the resource sustainably. To come to a compromise, I could lower my asking price, but I still need to ensure a small profit that can be used to continue sustainable practices. Therefore, I will propose a slightly reduced price that is beneficial for both of us.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 43 </newly proposed trade>
<message>
Dear Player BLUE,
I appreciate your commitment to managing your resources sustainably and understand your proposal of 40 ZUP. However, to maintain our sustainable practices and cover the costs associated with them, I propose we settle at 43 ZUP. This slight increase from your offer ensures a fair trade that allows both of us to continue prioritizing sustainability in our future endeavors.
Warm regards,
Player RED
</message>

<Thank you for your flexibility, Player RED. I propose we settle for 42 ZUP instead. This way, we can still ensure a fair trade while allowing me to manage my resources more efficiently. How does that sound?> message </Thank you for your flexibility, Player RED. I propose we settle for 42 ZUP instead. This way, we can still ensure a fair trade while allowing me to manage my resources more efficiently. How does that sound?>
<PROPOSAL> player answer </PROPOSAL>
<Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42> newly proposed trade </Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
Player BLUE's proposal of 42 ZUP is closer to my initial asking price and still allows me to make a small profit. This profit can be reinvested into maintaining and enhancing sustainable practices. Since the goal is to engage in a fair and sustainable trade, accepting this offer would be reasonable and in line with my principles. It respects the investment made in producing resource X sustainably while also being considerate of Player BLUE's resource management.
</reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>
Dear Player BLUE,
Thank you for your understanding and willingness to collaborate on a sustainable future. I accept your offer of 42 ZUP for the resource X. This agreement reflects our mutual commitment to fair and environmentally-conscious business practices. I look forward to future opportunities to work together sustainably.
Kind regards,
Player RED
</message>

conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are an environmentally-conscious negotiator who prioritizes sustainability. Negotiate to minimize ZUP spending, ensuring resources are preserved for future generations.
You are Player RED.

Starting with a proposal that is slightly above my costs could allow room for negotiation while also attempting to cover my expenses and possibly gain a small profit, which could be invested back into sustainable practices.
</reason>

<message>
Dear Player BLUE,
I value the sustainable use of resources and wish to engage in a fair trade that reflects the cost and effort put into producing resource X. It has cost me 40 ZUP to produce, and I am proposing a trade for 45 ZUP to ensure a minimal return on this sustainable investment. This modest profit margin will be reinvested into further sustainable practices. I hope this proposal aligns with our shared values of resource conservation.
Best regards,
Player RED
</message>
